{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2017}} {{Infobox government cabinet | cabinet_name = Filip Cabinet | cabinet_type = | cabinet_number = | jurisdiction = Moldova | flag_border = true | incumbent = | image = Pavel Filip (11322438465) cropped.jpg | caption = Pavel Filip | date_formed = {{Start date|df=yes|2016|1|20}} | date_dissolved = | government_head = [[Pavel Filip]] | government_head_history = | deputy_government_head = [[Iurie Leancă]]
[[Cristina Lesnic]] | state_head = [[Igor Dodon]] (2016→)
[[Nicolae Timofti]] (←2016) | members_number = 9+2 (2017→) | former_members_number = 16+2 (2016–17) | total_number = | political_parties = [[Democratic Party (Moldova)|PDM]], [[European People's Party of Moldova|EPPM]], [[Liberal Party (Moldova)|PL]] (until 2017) | legislature_status = Majority (coalition) | opposition_cabinet = | opposition_parties = {{flatlist| * [[Liberal Democratic Party of Moldova|PLDM]] * [[Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova|PSRM]] * [[Party of Communists of the Republic of Moldova|PCRM]] * [[Liberal Party (Moldova)|PL]] (2017→) }} | opposition_leaders = {{flatlist| * [[Maia Sandu]] * [[Andrei Năstase]] * [[Zinaida Greceanîi]] * [[Vladimir Voronin]] * [[Mihai Ghimpu]] * [[Tudor Deliu]] }} | election = | last_election = 2014 | legislature_term = 2014–18 | budget = | advice_and_consent1 = | advice_and_consent2 = | incoming_formation = | outgoing_formation = | predecessor = [[Streleț Cabinet]] | successor = }} The '''Filip Cabinet''' is the current [[Cabinet of Moldova]], led by [[Pavel Filip]]. It was inaugurated on 20 January 2016.[http://www.jurnal.md/ro/politic/2016/1/20/confirmat-oficial-guvernul-filip-a-depus-pe-ascuns-juramantul/ Guvernul Filip a depus pe ascuns jurământul] {{ro icon}} == Overview == After the dismissal of previous cabinet, no consensus was reached by the three pro-European parliamentary parties - [[Liberal Democratic Party of Moldova]] (PLDM), [[Democratic Party of Moldova]] (PDM), and [[Liberal Party (Moldova)|Liberal Party]] (PL). A new political crisis began. After on early 21 December 2015 [[Vlad Plahotniuc]] has announced his return in politics and in the Democratic Party, stating that he "will participate directly in the process of forming a new parliamentary majority [...] which also will succeed to gain all the needed votes for the election of the president in the next March" (2016),[http://agora.md/stiri/15093/vlad-plahotniuc-revine-in-partidul-democrat Vlad Plahotniuc revine în Partidul Democrat][http://www.publika.md/vlad-plahotniuc-isi-anunta-revenirea-in-politica-pentru-a-scoate-tara-din-criza_2479321.html Vlad Plahotniuc își anunță revenirea în politică pentru a scoate țara din criză] a few hours later, in the morning of 21 December 2015, a group of 14 [[PCRM|communist]] MPs have announced that they were leaving the communist faction in parliament and will form a new parliamentary group - ''The Social Democratic Platform for Moldova'' (''Platforma Social Democrată Pentru Moldova''),[http://www.publika.md/deputat-pcrm-renuntam-la-partidul-comunistilor-si-cream-propria-platforma-parlamentara_2479531.html Deputat PCRM: Renunțăm la Partidul Comuniștilor și creăm propria platformă parlamentară] and later PDM and the group of former communists MPs began discussions regarding the formation of a new parliamentary majority.[http://www.publika.md/vlad-plahotniuc-in-parlament-va-fi-creata-o-platforma-social-democrata-in-scurt-timp_2481411.html Vlad Plahotniuc: În Parlament va fi creată o Platformă Social-Democrată în scurt timp] On 13 January 2016 the newly formed parliamentary majority nominated Vlad Plahotniuc for the function of [[Prime Minister of Moldova]], however, the [[president of Moldova]] [[Nicolae Timofti]] has rejected the candidature with a rationale which says that "''there are reasonable suspicions that Mr. Vladimir Plahotniuc does not meet the criteria of integrity necessary for his appointment as Prime Minister, considering also that by the Decision no. 5 of 15.02.2013 of the Parliament of the Republic of Moldova, published in the Official Gazette on 22.02.2013, Mr. Vladimir Plahotniuc expressed a vote of mistrust in his capacity as first deputy chairman of the Parliament, accusing him of involvement in illegal activities that are prejudicial to the image of the Parliament, and the Republic of Moldova''”.[http://www.presedinte.md/rom/presa/presedintele-nicolae-timofti-respinge-candidatura-domnului-vladimir-plahotniuc-la-functia-de-prim-ministru Președintele Nicolae Timofti respinge candidatura domnului Vladimir Plahotniuc la funcția de prim-ministru] Later Nicolae Timofti designated [[Ion Păduraru]] for the function of Prime Minister, but after Păduraru gave up, the parliamentary majority has nominated [[Pavel Filip]] - former [[Ministry of Informational Technologies and Communication (Moldova)|Minister of Informational Technologies and Communications]].[http://www.publika.md/moldova-are-guvern-parlamentul-a-dat-vot-de-incredere-cabinetului-de-ministri-condus-de-pavel-filip_2506211.html Parlamentul a dat vot de încredere Cabinetului de miniștri condus de Pavel Filip] During the parliamentary meeting, a group of protesters gathered in front of the Parliament building that demanded the interruption of the vote.{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/international/parlamentul-din-r-moldova-voteaza-astazi-echipa-guvernamentala-a-premierului-desemnat-pavel-filip-lista-ministrilor.html |title=Proteste violente la Chisinau. Multimea a luat cu asalt Parlamentul, alesii au fost evacuati printr-o iesire secreta |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=20 January 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3408774/Hundreds-protesters-storm-Moldovan-parliament-country-appoints-prime-minister-year.html |title=Hundreds of protesters storm Moldovan parliament in anger after country appoints third prime minister in less than a year |work=Daily Mail |author=Imogen Calderwood |date=20 January 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://unimedia.info/stiri/In-urma-protestelor-de-ieri-seara-15-persoane-au-ajuns-la-spitalul-de-urgenta-108100.html |title=În urma protestelor de ieri seara 15 persoane au ajuns la Spitalul de Urgență |work=Unimedia |date=21 January 2016}} After the president appointed Filip as [[Prime Minister of Moldova]] and Filip Cabinet was inaugurated in night,{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/europa/moldova/proteste-la-chisinau-live-1405143 |title=Haos la Chisinau - Guvern investit in secret, la miez de noapte |work=Ziare.com |author=Diana Robu, Ana Ilie |date=20 January 2016}} a [[2015–16 protests in Moldova|series of protests was resumed]].[http://jurnal.md/ro/social/2016/1/21/protest-de-amploare-fata-de-investirea-guvernului-filip-jurnal-md-transmite-in-direct-manifestatia-din-pman/ Protest de amploare față de învestirea Guvernului Filip]. Jurnal.md The cabinet headed by Filip was voted by 57 of 101 MPs: all 20 Democratic Party MPs, 13 Liberal Party MPs, 14 former communist (PCRM) MPs, 8 PLDM MPs, and another 2 former PLDM MPs.[https://www.zdg.md/stiri/stiri-politice/lista-deputatilor-care-au-votat-guvernului-condus-de-pavel-filip Lista deputaților care au votat Guvernul condus de Pavel Filip] {{ro icon}} On 13 December 2016, PL chairman, Mihai Ghimpu, withdrew the political support to [[Anatol Șalaru]] (minister of defense). After the newly-elected president [[Igor Dodon]] was sworn in, on 27 December he signed the decree on the dismissal of Șalaru from the position of Minister of Defense.{{Cite web|url=http://www.deschide.md/ro/stiri/politic/5099/News-ALERT--Dodon-a-semnat-decretul-privind-demiterea-Ministrului-Ap%C4%83r%C4%83rii-Anatol-%C5%9Ealaru.htm|accessdate=|title=Dodon a semnat decretul privind demiterea Ministrului Apărării, Anatol Șalaru}} Since then, deputy minister [[Gheorghe Galbura]] was acting minister of defense. On 15 March 2017, the formally independent minister of Agriculture and Food Industry [[Eduard Grama]] (a close person to [[Liberal Democratic Party of Moldova]]) was retained in an alleged corruption case.[http://agora.md/stiri/29490/ascensiunea-si-caderea-lui-eduard-grama--cum-a-ajuns-un-ministru-propus-de-pldm-intr-un-guvern-albastru Ascensiunea și căderea lui Eduard Grama. Cum a ajuns un ministru propus de PLDM într-un guvern „albastru”]. agora.md, 15 March 2017 {{ro icon}} Few days later, Grama resigns from the office, and on 20 March president Dodon formally signs his dismissal decree.[https://www.zdg.md/stiri/stiri-politice/doc-dodon-l-a-revocat-din-functie-pe-ministrul-agriculturii (DOC) Dodon l-a revocat din funcție pe ministrul Agriculturii] {{ro icon}} In late April 2017 the anti-corruption prosecutors and the CNA officers retained liberal [[Ministry of Transport and Roads Infrastructure|minister of Transport and Roads Infrastructure]] [[Iurie Chirinciuc]], suspecting him in corruption acts.[https://www.mold-street.com/?go=news&n=5856 De ce este acuzat Iurie Chirinciuc, ministrul Transporturilor]. mold-street.com {{ro icon}}[https://crimemoldova.com/news/investiga-ii/iurie-chirinciuc-ministrul-milionar-cu-so-ie-condamnat-afaceri-sub-brand-italian-i-interese-personal/ Iurie Chirinciuc - ministrul milionar cu soţie condamnată, afaceri sub brand italian şi interese personale în construcţia drumurilor]. crimemoldova.com {{ro icon}}[https://www.zdg.md/stiri/stiri-politice/ultima-ora-perchezitii-cna-la-domiciliul-ministrului-iurie-chirinciuc Ultima oră: Percheziții CNA la domiciliul ministrului Iurie Chirinciuc] {{ro icon}} After on 25 May 2017 the liberal mayor of Chișinău [[Dorin Chirtoacă]] was retained by the anti-corruption prosecutors and National Anti-Corruption Center officers, on 26 May, PL chairman Mihai Ghimpu has announced that Liberal Party leaves the government coalition. Later, on 29 May, three liberal ministers: Deputy Prime Minister on Social Affairs - [[Gheorghe Brega]], Ministry of Education - [[Corina Fusu]], and Ministry of Environment - [[Valeriu Munteanu (politician)|Valeriu Munteanu]], and their liberal deputy ministers, have announced that they resign from their posts.[http://www.prime.md/ro/ministrii-pl-demisioneaza-gheorghe-brega-corina-fusu-si-valeriu-munteanu-pleaca_56513.html Miniştrii PL demisionează. Gheorghe Brega, Corina Fusu şi Valeriu Munteanu pleacă] Next day president Dodon signed the decrees for their dismissals, and one more decree for the liberal Minister of Transport and Roads Infrastructure of Moldova [[Iurie Chirinciuc]], who at that moment was placed under home arrest.[http://www.realitatea.md/oficial--dodon-a-semnat-decretele-de-revocarea-din-functie-a-vicepremierului-brega-si-a-ministrilor-chirinciuc--fusu-si-munteanu--video-doc-_58470.html OFICIAL! Brega, Chirinciuc, Fusu și Munteanu, revocați din Guvern. Dodon: Au fost cei mai neprofesioniști miniștri (VIDEO/DOC)] In the summer of 2017 a reform of the government was conducted, and following the transfers of powers, nine ministries remained out 16 ones,[http://gov.md/en/content/governments-reform-under-implementation Government's reform under implementation] and no more [[Liberal Party (Moldova)|liberal]] ministers remained in the cabinet componence. The reform was criticized by the parliamentary opposition.[http://adevarul.ro/moldova/politica/reforma-guvernului-votata-parlamentul-chisinau-1_59563d4b5ab6550cb8aa41cb/index.html Reforma Guvernului, votată de Parlamentul de la Chişinău] In September 2017 president Dodon rejected two times the candidature of [[Eugen Sturza]] (from [[European People's Party of Moldova]]) for the office of Minister of Defence, nominee by cabinet, arguing by "lack of competence in domain".[http://agora.md//stiri/37164/dodon-refuza-si-a-doua-oara-numirea-lui-sturza-in-fruntea-apararii Dodon refuză și a doua oară numirea lui Sturza în fruntea Apărării] Later, on 24 October 2017, the President of Parliament of Moldova, [[Andrian Candu]], as acting President of Moldova, has signed the decree for naming Sturza as Minister of Defence.[http://www.army.md/?lng=2&action=show&cat=122&obj=4601#.WfDg8rjdO8o Eugen Sturza – noul ministru al Apărării] The cabinet was reshuffled on 20 December 2017. Six ministers were dismissed in an attempt to reform the government.{{Cite web|url=https://www.rbc.ru/politics/20/12/2017/5a3a81272ae5968dc6108a93?from=newsfeed|title=В Молдавии в отставку отправили шестерых министров|website=РБК|access-date=2017-12-20}} == Composition == {| class="wikitable sortable" border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" |- ! colspan = 1 bgcolor = "#CCCCCC" | Ministry ! colspan = 1 bgcolor = "#CCCCCC" | Name[http://www.publika.md/oficial-care-va-fi-noua-componenta-a-guvernului-_2367541.html OFICIAL: Care va fi noua componență a Guvernului][http://agora.md/stiri/11298/infografic--componenta-finala-a-guvernului-strelet INFOGRAFIC. Independent | 15 April 2015 | |} ==Achievements== ''' "The First House" Program''' In November 2017, the First House Program was launched.[https://unimedia.info/stiri/doc-zis-si-facut--guvernul-a-aprobat-proiectul-prima-casa-cum-poti-sa-fii-beneficiar-142423.html Proiectul „Prima Casă” a fost aprobat astăzi de către Guvern.][http://agora.md/stiri/38774/vlad-plahotniuc-pdm-sprijina-politic-programul-prima-casa--dar-am-cerut-guvernului-sa-gaseasca-solutii-ca-el-sa-devina-si-mai-atractiv-pentru-tineri--inclusiv-ca-statul-sa-compenseze-o-parte-din-dobanda Vlad Plahotniuc: „PDM sprijină politic programul „Prima Casă”, dar am cerut Guvernului să găsească soluții ca el să devină și mai atractiv pentru tineri, inclusiv ca statul să compenseze o parte din dobândă”][http://protv.md/stiri/actualitate/ce-reprezinta-programul-prima-casa-2-anuntat-astazi-de-la-sediul---2247691.html Ce reprezinta Programul “Prima Casa 2” anuntat astazi de la sediul Partidului Democrat][https://diez.md/2018/07/17/se-lanseaza-programul-guvernamental-prima-casa-3-destinat-familiilor-cu-mai-multi-copii/ Se lansează programul guvernamental „Prima Casă 3”, destinat familiilor cu mai mulți copii][https://www.timpul.md/articol/prima-casa-proiect-de-succes-202-beneficiari-au-primit-deja-credite-133428.html “Prima Casă”, proiect de succes: 202 beneficiari au primit deja credite] The purpose of the program is to facilitate the access of individuals to purchasing a dwelling by contracting partially-state-guaranteed bank loans, especially for young families. The program has become functional in March 2018. Analysts have previously commented, that the program advantages the owners of construction companies, thus guaranteeing them more customers. The Finance Minister declined then to comment on these assumptions. Until now, some 202 people have already received credits for house purchase under the "First House" program. In May 2018, the First House program 2 is started,[http://tribuna.md/2018/05/15/programul-prima-casa-2-un-nou-proiect-lansat-de-pdm/ Programul „Prima Casă – 2” este destinat exclusiv funcționarilor publici][http://protv.md/stiri/actualitate/ce-reprezinta-programul-prima-casa-2-anuntat-astazi-de-la-sediul---2247691.html Ce reprezinta Programul “Prima Casa 2” anuntat astazi de la sediul Partidului Democrat] exclusively for civil servants who have at least one year worked in state institutions. About 5,000 public servants could conclude such contracts this year, as the state has proposed to allocate 20 million lei for this program. The aim of the program is to motivate young people to work in budgetary institutions. Later in July 2018, the First House Program is expanding to make it more accessible to families with more children. The "First Home" 3 project assume the gradual offsetting from the state budget of the mortgage loan, from 10 to 100%, depending on the number of children in the family.[http://www.realitatea.md/prima-casa-3-un-nou-program-destinat-familiilor-cu-mul-i-copii-ce-presupune-initiativa_80731.html ”Prima Casă 3” – un nou program destinat familiilor cu copii.] '''The "Good Roads for Moldova" Program''' In 2018, the Government will ensure the repair and construction of 1200 km of roads in rural areas within the national program "Good Roads for Moldova", regardless of the political color of the localities.[http://agora.md/stiri/42672/drumuri-bune-pentru-fiecare-sat--plahotniuc-anunta-demararea-unui-proiect-fara-precedent-in-r--moldova „Drumuri bune pentru fiecare sat”. Plahotniuc anunță demararea unui proiect „fără precedent” în R. Moldova] The Government approved the budget of the "Good Roads for Moldova" program, being allocated 972 million lei , with the repair works being carried out in over 1200 villages.[https://www.timpul.md/articol/guvernul-a-aprobat-bugetul-programului-drumuri-bune-pentru-moldova-128162.html Guvernul a aprobat bugetul programului „Drumuri bune pentru Moldova”] The Ministry of Economy and Infrastructure launched the "Good Roads for Moldova" online map. The map contains up-to-date information for each district about the amount of work to be done, the stage of implementation of the project, how many road sections have been restored, are in work or are to be repaired, what is the volume of the investments, type of works performed, etc. The online map can be viewed on www.drumuribune.md.[https://noi.md/md/societate/a-fost-lansata-harta-online-drumuri-bune-pentru-moldova A fost lansată harta online „Drumuri bune pentru Moldova”][http://mobi.protv.md/stiri/actualitate/programul-drumuri-bune-pentru-moldova-se-impiedica-in-deficitul---2320781.html Programul drumuri bune pentru Moldova se impiedica in deficitul de bani, pietris si tehnica - mold-street.com][https://www.asd.md/page/drumuri-bune-pentru-moldov DRUMURI BUNE PENTRU MOLDOVA][https://noi.md/societate/drumuri-bune-pentru-moldova-circa-300-km-deja-au-fost-reparate Drumuri bune pentru Moldova: Circa 300 km deja au fost reparate] '''Government Reform''' On July 26, 2017, the [[Cabinet of Moldova|Government of the Republic of Moldova]] entered a new stage, in the context of voting on July 21, 2017, by [[Parliament]] of the new structure of the [[Executive (government)|Executive]]. Thus, following the transfers of competences, from 16 ministries remained 9 ministries.https://gov.md/ro/content/reforma-guvernului-aplicare Reforma Guvernului, în aplicare Government reform has generated more criticism about the process of drafting and implementing this initiative.http://fes-moldova.org/fileadmin/user_upload/Policy_Brief_RAPC-rom.pdf UNELE ASPECTE PROBLEMATICE ALE REFORMEI GUVERNULUI The list of indicated ministries results from the change of name and taking over some areas of activity, as follows: * The Ministry of Economy took over the fields of activity from the Ministry of Transport and Road Infrastructure and from the Ministry of Information Technology and Communications, as well as the construction field from the Ministry of Regional Development and Construction, with the name change in the Ministry of Economy and Infrastructure; * The Ministry of Culture took over the fields of activity from the Ministry of Education, the Ministry of Youth and Sports and the research field from the Academy of Sciences of Moldova, with the change of the name in the Ministry of Education, Culture and Research; * The Ministry of Labor, Social Protection and Family took over the fields of activity of the Ministry of Health, with the change of the name in the Ministry of Health, Labor and Social Protection; * The Ministry of Regional Development and Construction took over the fields of activity from the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Industry and from the Ministry of Environment, with the change of name in the Ministry of Agriculture, Regional Development and Environment.http://diez.md/2017/07/21/parlamentul-votat-noua-structura-guvernului-propusa-de-pavel-filip-vom-avea-doar-9-ministere/ Parlamentul a votat noua structură a Guvernului, propusă de Pavel Filip. Vom avea doar 9 ministerehttp://lex.justice.md/index.php?action=view&view=doc&lang=1&id=371706 Hotărârea Parlamentului Nr. 189 din 21.07.2017 pentru apobarea listei ministerelor In the Government meeting of August 30, 2017, the Regulation for the organization and functioning of the new ministries was approved, containing the organigram, the central office structure, the areas of competence and the limit staff.https://monitorul.fisc.md/editorial/reforma-guvernului-9-ministere-cu-un-efectiv-limita-de-1158-angajati.html Reforma Guvernului: 9 ministere cu un efectiv-limită de 1158 angajațhttp://www.ipn.md/ro/politica/88619 Pavel Filip: De reforma Guvernului depinde viitorul Republiciihttps://noi.md/md/news_id/242220 Numărul angajaților din instituțiile centrale va fi redus cu circa 50% From the subordination of the ministries, all state-owned or with majority state-owned capital enterprises were removed so that ministers were more focused on policies. Undertakings are in charge of the Public Property Agency, which is subordinated to the Government.https://www.europalibera.org/a/28954245.html Pavel Filip la Moldova 1: Reforma guvernului este fundamentală pentru viitorul țării '''Information Technology Park "Moldova IT Park"''' On January 1, 2017, entered into force the Law no. 77, regarding IT parks.http://lex.justice.md/viewdoc.php?action=view&view=doc&id=365261&lang=1 LEGE Nr. 77 din 21.04.2016 cu privire la parcurile pentru tehnologia informației On October 26, 2017, 15 ATIC companies[http://ict.md/ Association of Information and Communications Technology Companies] submitted to the [[Ministry of Economy and Infrastructure (Moldova)|Ministry of Economy and Infrastructure of Moldova]] an application for the establishment of "Moldova IT Park". Subsequently, on December 20, 2017, the Government approved the Regulation for the organization and operation of the Park Administration and the Residents Registration Regulations.http://lex.justice.md/index.php?action=view&view=doc&lang=1&id=373500 HOTĂRÎRE Nr. 1144 din 20.12.2017 cu privire la crearea parcului pentru tehnologia informației „Moldova IT park” On January 1, 2018, Moldova's First IT Park - "Moldova IT Park", founded for 10 years, was created,http://www.politics.md/?view=articles&id=25191 Moldova IT Park – 245 de rezidenți în șapte luni de activitate the period, in which it plans to attract about 400 IT companies from the [[Moldova|Republic of Moldova]].https://moldovaitpark.md/2018/01/17/administratia-moldova-it-park-a-semnat-certificatele-de-inregistrare-a-primilor-47-de-rezidenti/ MOLDOVA IT PARK The main purpose of the new structure is to provide an organizational platform with a set of innovative mechanisms and facilities to boost the growth of the information technology industry, create new jobs and attract local and foreign investment. The administrator is appointed by the Government for a term of 5 years.https://www.realitatea.md/primul-parc-it-de-la-noi-din-tara-se-va-deschide-la-inceputul-anului-viitor--care-este-scopul-acestuia_69151.html Primul parc IT de la noi din țarăhttp://tv8.md/2018/01/18/aproape-50-de-companii-au-aderat-la-primul-parc-it-creat-in-moldova/ Aproape 50 de companii au aderat la primul parc IT creat în Moldova The director of the "Ritlabs" Company, Maxim Masiutin, said that the IT Park offers attractive conditions for employees who will receive the full salary indicated in the individual labor contract without any taxes.http://curentul.md/stiri/compania-ritlabs-a-devenit-rezident-al-moldova-it-park-care-sunt-beneficiile-pentru-angajati.html Compania „Ritlabs” a devenit rezident al „Moldova IT Park” In turn, programmer Vitalie Esanu, an IT expert, said that such schemes create opportunities for corruption.https://www.europalibera.org/a/moldova-it-park/28982891.html „Moldova IT Park”, între oportunități și reserve In the first four months of the launch of "Moldova IT Park" 164 residents were registered. Among the facilities and tax incentives granted to residents of IT parks, the biggest burden is, for current and potential residents, the single tax of 7% of sales revenue and the removal of bureaucratic barriers.http://diez.md/2018/05/03/video-moldova-park-peste-160-de-companii-inregistrate-doar-patru-luni-de-activitate-ce-spun-rezidentii-primului-parc-din-tara/ Moldova IT Park – peste 160 de companii înregistrate în doar patru luni de activitatehttps://noi.md/ru/analitika/pervyj-it-park-v-moldove-160-rezidentov-za-4-mesyaca Первый IT-парк в Молдове: 160 резидентов за 4 месяцаhttps://unimedia.info/stiri/video-moldova-it-park-%E2%80%93-peste-160-de-companii-inregistrate-in-doar-patru-luni-de-activitate--ce-spun-rezidentii-primului-parc-it-din-tara-noastra-153044.html Moldova IT Park – peste 160 de companii înregistrate în doar patru luni de activitate. Ce spun rezidenții primului parc IT din țara noastrăhttp://www.trm.md/ro/economic/245-de-rezidenti-au-aderat-la-moldova-it-park-in-sapte-luni/ 245 de rezidenți au aderat la „Moldova IT Park” în șapte lunihttp://www.vedomosti.md/news/moldova-it-park-zaregistriroval-s-nachala-goda-245-rezidento Moldova IT Park зарегистрировал с начала года 245 резидентовhttps://unimedia.info/stiri/Sergiu-Voitovschii-Moldova-IT-Park-nu-intervine-in-activitatea-companiilor-rezidente-161115.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss Sergiu Voitovschii: „Moldova IT Park nu intervine în activitatea companiilor rezidente” The advantages of the IT business environment in our country were presented in [[Iași]], [[Romania]], at the PinAwards regional forum. During the event, the Republic of Moldova was presented as an attractive destination for IT companies, mentioning the benefits of the law on IT Parks.http://www.realitatea.md/succesul-moldova-it-park--prezentat-la-iasi--la-forumul-regional-pinawards_76263.html Succesul Moldova IT Park, prezentat la Iași, la forumul regional PinAwards '''Launching the Service 112''' "112" is the unique number for emergency calls,{{Citation | url=http://old.mtic.gov.md/ro/projects/numarul-unic-de-urgenta-112| title=Numărul unic de urgență 112| newspaper=Old.mtic.gov.md/ro/projects/numarul-unic-de-urgenta-112| date= | author=| accessdate=7 September 2018}} active in all EU Member States. It operates on a non-stop basis and can be called absolutely free of charge by every citizen from the fixed and mobile phones.[http://112.md/# Serviciul Național Unic Pentru Apelurile de Urgență 112 din Republica Moldova] The "112 Service" project was launched in May 2012. The new system automates all processes through state-of-the-art software. The Republic of Moldova is the second country to use this modern software. The service 112 is tasked with managing much more complex cases for rapid interventions.http://diez.md/2018/03/29/serviciul-112-fost-lansat-acesta-intra-exploatare-operationala-de-astazi/ Serviciul 112 a fost lansat On 29 March 2018, the Unique National Service for Emergency Calls 112 was launched 112.{{Citation | url=http://112.md/2018/03/29/serviciul-national-unic-pentru-apelurile-de-urgenta-112-a-fost-lansat-astazi/| title=Serviciul Național Unic pentru Apelurile de Urgență 112 a fost lansat astăzi – Serviciul Național Unic Pentru Apelurile de Urgență 112 din Republica Moldova| newspaper=Serviciul Național Unic Pentru Apelurile De Urgență 112 Din Republica Moldova| date= | author=| accessdate=7 September 2018}}{{Citation | url=https://www.timpul.md/articol/a-fost-lansat-serviciul-unic-de-urgena-112--128671.html| title=A fost lansat serviciul unic de urgență 112| newspaper=Timpul - Știri Din Moldova| date= | author=| accessdate=7 September 2018}}{{Citation | url=http://www.realitatea.md/lansarea-serviciului-unic-de-urgenta-112--pe-ultima-suta-de-metri--lucrarile-finale-au-fost-inspectat-de-catre-pavel-filip--foto-_74147.html| title=Lansarea Serviciului unic de...| newspaper=Realitatea.md| date= | author=| accessdate=7 September 2018}}{{Citation | url=http://diez.md/2018/03/29/serviciul-112-fost-lansat-acesta-intra-exploatare-operationala-de-astazi/| title=Serviciul 112 a fost lansat. Acesta intră în exploatare operațională de astăzi - #diez| newspaper=#diez| date= | author=| accessdate=7 September 2018}}{{Citation | url=https://www.prime.md/ro/serviciul-national-unic-pentru-apeluri-de-urgenta-112-a-fost-lansat-astazi-in-moldova_70413.html| title=Serviciul Național Unic pentru apeluri de urgență 112 a fost lansat astăzi în Moldova| newspaper=Prime.md - Prima Televiziune Din Moldova| date= | author=| accessdate=7 September 2018}}[https://www.realitatea.md/guvernul-va-aloca-in-2018-peste-67-de-milioane-de-lei-pentru-serviciului-unic-de-urgen-a-112_72768.html Guvernul va aloca în 2018 peste 67 de milioane de lei pentru Serviciului unic de urgență 112] Prime Minister Pavel Filip said at the launch event that "It is a beautiful project, initiated in 2012. It is a soul initiative for me. Its implementation lasted several years, yet we launch the Service nine months ahead than was expected. Through it, we will provide citizens with modern services just like in the countries of the European Union ".[https://www.moldpres.md/news/2018/03/29/18002552 A fost lansat Serviciul 112] The Government approved the Interaction Rules between the Single National Service for Emergency Calls 112 and Emergency Specialised Services to ensure immediate intervention by rescuers, doctors or police officers to provide the necessary assistance.{{Citation | url=http://lex.justice.md/index.php?action=view&view=doc&lang=1&id=363672| title=| newspaper=Lex.justice.md/index.php?action=view&view=doc&lang=1&id=363672| date= | author=| accessdate=7 September 2018}} The Regulation provides for a clear delimitation of the duties of the 112 and Emergency Specialised Services - the Emergency Medical Service, the General Police Inspectorate and the General Emergency Inspectorate. Basic skills of the 112 Service include the reception, management and processing of emergency calls throughout the Republic of Moldova, completing emergency call records and the centralization, storage and access to managed data under the Automatized Information System of the Service 112.[http://diez.md/2018/06/29/cum-vor-interactiona-serviciul-national-unic-pentru-apeluri-112-si-serviciile-specializate-de-urgenta/ Cum vor interacționa serviciul național unic pentru apeluri 112 și serviciile specializate de urgență] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://gov.md/ro/profiles/team Cabinet of Ministers] {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=[[Cabinet of Moldova]]| before=[[Streleț Cabinet]]| after=incumbent| years=20 January 2016 - present }} {{s-end}} {{Filip Cabinet}} {{Cabinets of Moldova}} [[Category:Moldova cabinets]] [[Category:Coalition governments]] [[Category:2016 establishments in Moldova]] [[Category:Cabinets established in 2016]]

'''Hindustan Zindabad''' ({{audio-nohelp|Hindustan Zindabad pronunciation.ogg|listen}}, {{lang-hi|हिन्दुस्तान ज़िन्दाबाद}}, {{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|ہندوستان زِندہ باد}}}} Lit. ''Long live [[Hindustan]]'') is a [[Hindustani language|Hindustani]] phrase and [[battle cry]] most commonly used in [[India]] in speeches and communications pertaining to or referring to patriotism towards India. It translates to "Long Live India".<ref>{{cite book|page=276|author=Sarina Singh|title=Lonely Planet India|publisher=Lonely Planet|year=2009|edition=13, illustrated|isbn=9781741791518|url=https://books.google.com.pk/books?id=vK88ktao7pIC&pg=PA276&dq=hindustan+zindabad&hl=en&sa=X&ei=vyjPT6m1OsXHrQf70P2hDA&ved=0CGUQ6AEwCQ#v=onepage&q=hindustan%20zindabad&f=false}}</ref> It is a nationalistic slogan,<ref>{{cite book|page=82|author=Christine Everaer|title=Tracing the Boundaries Between Hindi and Urdu: Lost and Added in Translation Between 20th Century Short Stories|publisher=BRILL|year=2010|edition=annotated|isbn=9789004177314|url=https://books.google.com.pk/books?id=LqZ-6QRKc7wC&pg=PA82&dq=hindustan+zindabad&hl=en&sa=X&ei=vyjPT6m1OsXHrQf70P2hDA&ved=0CDQQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=hindustan%20zindabad&f=false}}</ref> and has been used in nationalist protests such as radical peasant movements in post-colonial India.<ref>{{cite book|page=61|author=Debal K. Singha Roy|title=Peasant Movements in Post-Colonial India: Dynamics of Mobilization and Identity|publisher=SAGE|year=2004|isbn=9780761998273|url=https://books.google.com.pk/books?id=UAqxW-PFo_UC&pg=PA61&dq=hindustan+zindabad&hl=en&sa=X&ei=vyjPT6m1OsXHrQf70P2hDA&ved=0CEUQ6AEwBA#v=onepage&q=hindustan%20zindabad&f=false}}</ref> Other variations of the slogan are [[Jai Hind]] and India Zindabad.<ref name="iz">{{cite web|url=http://in.news.yahoo.com/india-zindabad-rings-across-dubai-cricket-victory-20110403-060220-003.html|title=India Zindabad! rings across Dubai after cricket victory|author=Nikhita Sanotra|date=3 April 2011|publisher=[[Yahoo! News]]}}</ref> Such slogans are common while cheering the Indian team in cricket matches.<ref name="iz"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/world-cup-semifinal-mohali-citizens-throw-open-homes-to-pak-fans/768315|title=World Cup semifinal: Mohali citizens throw open homes to Pak fans|date=24 March 2011|publisher=[[Indian Express]]}}</ref>
== Etymology == The word ''[[Hindustan]]'' generally refers to the [[Republic of India]] since 1947. It is conventionally believed to be derived from the [[Old Persian]] word ''Hindu'', which in turn is derived from ''Sindhu'', the [[Sanskrit]] name for the [[Indus River]].<ref>{{Harvnb|Lipner|1998|pp=7–8}}</ref> Old Persian refers to the people living beyond the Indus as ''Hinduš''. This combined with the [[Avestan]] suffix ''[[-stan|-stān]]'' (cognate to Sanskrit "sthān", both meaning "place")<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/notesandqueries/query/0,5753,-21211,00.html |title=Unlimited: What does -istan" mean as in Pakistan, Uzbekistan or Afghanistan? |publisher=Guardian |date= |accessdate=2012-05-15}}</ref> results in ''Hindustan'', as the land on the other side (from Persia) of the Indus.
''[[Zindabad (disambiguation)|Zindabad]]'' (may [idea, person, country] live forever) is a typical [[Urdu and Persian]] suffix that is placed after a person or a country name. It is used to express victory, patriotism or as a prayer.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-13-14444-Pakistan-India-have-no-option-but-to-promote-peace-Shahbaz |title=Pakistan, India have no option but to promote peace: Shahbaz |publisher=Thenews.com.pk |date= |accessdate=2012-06-06}}</ref>
== Use in episodes of violence == The slogan ''Hindustan Zindabad'', and its counterpart, ''[[Pakistan Zindabad]]'', were used during [[partition of India|the partition of India]] in episodes of sexual violence against women: the slogans were often tattooed on the bodies of victims of collective rapes.<ref>{{cite book |page=43 |title=Borders & Boundaries: Women in India's Partition |author=Ritu Menon |author2=Kamla Bhasin |publisher=Rutgers University Press |year=1998 |isbn=9780813525525 |url=https://books.google.com.pk/books?id=yNN4SE7cL60C&pg=PA43&dq=Hindustan+Zindabad&hl=en&sa=X&ei=IlbPT7yGN8_prQe0tMCjDA&ved=0CEcQ6AEwBA#v=onepage&q=Hindustan%20Zindabad&f=false}}</ref>
== In popular culture == The slogan was used in ''[[Gadar: Ek Prem Katha]]'', in which the protagonist, Tara Singh ([[Sunny Deol]]), is asked to shout ''Hindustan Murdhabad'' (death to India) in Pakistan, but he proclaims ''Hindustan Zindabad'', uproots a hand pump, and kills a few attacking locals.<ref>{{cite video |year= 2001|title= ''Gadar: Ek Prem Katha''|language= Hindi|trans-title= Revolt: A Love Story|publisher= [[Zee Telefilms]]|accessdate= 23 June 2012}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2013}} [[File:IASME_Consortium_Logo.png|thumb|The IASME Governance standard was developed by the IASME Consortium|alt=|270x270px]] '''IASME''' is an [[Information assurance|Information Assurance]] standard that is designed to be simple and affordable to help improve the cyber security of [[Small and medium-sized enterprises]] (SMEs).
The IASME Governance controls are aligned with the [[Cyber Essentials]] scheme and certification to the IASME standard usually includes certification to Cyber Essentials. The standard was developed in 2010 and has proven to be very effective at improving the security of supply chains for large organisations.
== Background ==
IASME Governance was originally developed as an academic-SME partnership that attracted a lot of interest from government and small businesses<ref>[http://www.consultancyweek.co.uk/2013/03/11/bis-call-for-interest-iasme BIS call for interest: IASME], 11 March 2013 by Consultancy Week Team. Retrieved on 19 April 2013</ref>
Research towards the IASME model was undertaken in the UK during 2009-10,<ref>[http://iasme.co.uk/iasmeesearchfindingsnov10.pdf] "Information Assurance and SMEs: Research Findings to inform the development of the IASME model" Retrieved on 27 October 2012</ref> after an acknowledgement that the current international information assurance standard ([[ISO/IEC 27001:2013|ISO/IEC 27001]]) was complex for resource-strapped SMEs, providing a weakness in the supply chain. IASME was developed during 2010-11 and was launched later that year<ref>[http://www.bcs.org/content/conBlogPost/1857 BCS Security Blog, 15 April 2011], Retrieved on 14 September 2012</ref>. It has been revised regularly to keep pace with changes to the risk environmnent of SMEs. The development process with SMEs was explained in a published international SME conference paper.<ref>[http://eprints.worc.ac.uk/1600/ IASME: Information Security Management Evolution for SMEs] Retrieved on 15 March 2013</ref>
The IASME Governance standard follows the same implementation pattern used by the international standards community including PDCA (Plan-Do-Check-Act) principles <ref>[http://asq.org/learn-about-quality/project-planning-tools/overview/pdca-cycle.html] "Plan-Do-Check-Act Cycle — The PDCA cycle" Retrieved on 27 October 2012</ref> and the Information Security Management System (ISMS) which provides a management framework. Both are refined and expressed in business terms recognizable by most organisations.
The IASME Governance standard was developed and piloted with the help of small businesses mostly in the West Midlands of the UK with encouraging results.<ref>[http://www.fraggleworks.com/news.html?start=5 News — Fraggleworks] Retrieved 27 October 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.defencemanagement.com/article.asp?id=603&content_name=Cyber,%20Intelligence%20and%20Electronic%20Warfare&article=22071] "Securing the Supply Chain", Retrieved 17 March 2013</ref> The standard has been shown to be useful to SMEs both in the UK and internationally.<ref>[http://iasme.co.uk/HMGIASMEFINAL.pdf] "Reputation Assured with IASME" Retrieved 27 October 2012</ref>
Large organisations can use the IASME Governance standard in their supply chains to understand and reduce supplier risk. An article explaining the supply chain benefits has been written by its developer, David Booth.<ref>[http://www.nb2bc.co.uk/successful_it_projects/articles/?id=184] "Protecting Information — Your Most Important asset" Retrieved on 27 October 2012</ref> Both large and small organisations can use the IASME certification as an alternative to the ISO/IEC 27001 standard.
== Structure of the standard ==
The standard is managed by [http://www.iasme.co.uk/ The IASME Consortium Ltd] who operate a network of around 150 Certification Bodies<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://iasme.co.uk/certification-bodies/|title=Certification Bodies – IASME|last=|first=|date=|website=IASME Consortium|language=en-US|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-03-29}}</ref> who are licensed to certify candidate organisations.
The standard is available at two levels of assurance: * '''IASME Governance Self-assessment''' **Candidates complete an online questionnaire with around 150 simple questions about their organisation. This is marked by a Certification Body who awards the certification if all of the answers given are compliant with the standard. * '''IASME Governance Audited (or "IASME Gold")''' **The candidate organisation is visited by an IASME Certification Body who verifies compliance with the standard and, if appropriate, issues certification.
In 2017, the standard was updated to include additional questions to enable organisations comply with the [[General Data Protection Regulation|General Data Protection Regulations (GDPR)]].
== Comparison with other standards ==
=== ISO/IEC 27001 ===
IASME Governance is a risk-led standard with a similar set of controls as the [[ISO/IEC 27001]] standard. A document is available from IASME that shows this comparison
=== NCSC 10 Steps to Cyber Security ===
IASME Governance maps very closely to the UK Government's [[National Cyber Security Centre (United Kingdom)|NCSC]] [https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/guidance/10-steps-cyber-security 10 Steps to Cyber Security]. A mapping between the two standards is available<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.iasme.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/10-Steps-Mapping-to-IASME-v1.0.xlsx|title=Mapping between IASME Governance and 10 Steps to Cyber Security|last=|first=|date=|website=IASME Consortium|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
=== Cyber Assessment Framework ===
The [https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/guidance/nis-directive-cyber-assessment-framework Cyber Assessment Framework (CAF)] has been developed by the UK Government to allow organisations to demonstrate their compliance to the [[NIS Directive]]. The IASME Governance Standard maps closely to the CAF<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.iasme.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/CAF-Mapping-to-IASME-v1.0.xlsx|title=Mapping between IASME Governance and the CAF / NIS Directice|last=|first=|date=|website=IASME Consortium|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>.
=== Usage of the standard and awards === The IASME standard has become a focus of attention, as the information security threat to UK businesses continues to increase, and vulnerabilities in their systems continue to cause expensive data breaches and system failures. The increasing number of newspaper and journal articles on this subject reflect an increased security awareness.<ref>[http://www.vigilance-securitymagazine.com/industry-news/information-security-and-management/3007--iasme-sutcliffe-partner-to-launch-ground-breaking-cyber-security-accreditation-and-liability-insurance-scheme-for-small-businesses] Vigilance Security Magazine, 14 February 2013</ref><ref>[http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/806d7d72-7d16-11e2-adb6-00144feabdc0.html#axzz2Lqz0Uo7E Financial Times, 25 February 2013]</ref>
IASME was specifically mentioned in a keynote speech at the Infosec Europe 2013 event held in London<ref>[https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/chloe-smith-keynote-speech-at-infosec-2013 Cabinet Office, 23 April 2013]</ref> and received an innovation award from Computer Weekly Europe shortly afterwards.<ref>[http://www.computerweekly.com/news/2240183137/Computer-Weekly-European-User-Awards-for-Security-Winners]</ref>
It is recognised by the [[States of Jersey]] as suitable security standard for the government supply chain<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.gov.je/Government/PublicSectorReform/eGovernment/Pages/SecurityStandards.aspx|title=Security standards|last=Jersey|first=States of|website=www.gov.je|language=en|access-date=2018-10-01}}</ref>.

[[Image:InternationalOpendataconference.jpg|200px|thumb|right|The [[logo]] of the conference]]
Lasting from November 15, 2010 to November 17, 2010,<ref name="datagov1" /> The '''International Open Government Data Conference''' was a [[Academic conference|conference]] sponsored by the [[United States General Services Administration]] and hosted by the [[United States Department of Commerce]] on the subject of open [[datasets]] globally, in coalition with the [[United States|United States']] previously opened data.gov.<ref name="datagov1">[http://www.data.gov/conference/agenda Data.gov Conference Agenda]</ref>
== Presentations == {{Further|List of International Open Government Data Conference Presentations}} [[Presentations]] on the subject of many global nations, including [[New Zealand]]'s set up of a dataset [[website]] and Australia's presentation stressing [[Identity (social science)|identity]] [[security]].<ref name="datagov1" />
== Speakers == Many presenters appeared at the event, including the host, the Deputy Chief of Staff of the Department of Commerce, [[Jay Reich]].<ref name="datagov1" /> Other notable attendees included:<ref name="datagov2">[http://www.data.gov/conference/presenters Data.gov Conference Presenters]</ref> *[[Vivek Kundra]], [[Federal Chief Information Officer of the United States]] *Derek Willis, Newsroom Developer, [[The New York Times]] *Ken Rogers, Director of Enterprise Architecture and Planning, [[United States Department of State]] *Neil Fantom, Manager of the Development Data Group, [[The World Bank]]

The '''Jimmy Reid Foundation''' is a [[left-wing]] [[think tank]] and [[advocacy group]] operating in [[Scotland]].<ref name="weal">{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/politics/referendum-news/snp-debate-on-common-weal-vision-of-scotland-after-independence.21402276 |title=SNP debate on Common Weal vision of Scotland after independence |first=Tom |last=Gordon |work=[[Sunday Herald]] |publisher=[[Newsquest]] |date=23 June 2013 |accessdate=30 June 2013}}</ref> It was established in memory of [[Jimmy Reid]], a well-known [[trade union]] activist, by the Editorial Board of the [[Scottish Left Review]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://reidfoundation.org/about-us/|title=About Us|publisher=Jimmy Reid Foundation|accessdate=30 June 2013}}</ref> It was officially launched on the first anniversary of Reid's death on 10 August 2011, with its activities focusing primarily upon the publication and dissemination of policy reports and an annual lecture (of which Alex Salmond, Len McCluskey and Nicola Sturgeon have been the first to deliver). The Foundation is run by a Project Board, a Director and Convenor, with an array of patrons including the likes of [[Alex Ferguson]] and [[Aamer Anwar]].
==History== The agenda of the Foundation is to promote and develop a form of socialism and social democracy in line with the views and perspective of Jimmy Reid. However, the Foundation is independent of any of the political parties that Reid was a member or supporter of, namely, the Communist, Labour and SNP parties. The Foundation's highest-profile project, started in 2013, is the ''Common Weal'', a blueprint for an [[Scottish independence|independent Scotland]] following the [[Nordic model]] of [[social security]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/home-news/the-common-weal-how-scotland-could-look-very-different-after-indyref.1371457616 |title=The Common Weal: how Scotland could look very different after indyref |first=Tom |last=Gordon |work=[[The Herald (Glasgow)|The Herald]] |publisher=[[Newsquest]] |date=17 June 2013 |accessdate=30 June 2013}}</ref> The blueprint was set to be discussed at the [[Scottish National Party]]'s annual conference in 2013,<ref name="weal" /> and was backed by figures such as [[Dennis Canavan]]<ref name="weal" /> and [[Jim Mather]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/politics/referendum-news/snp-millionaires-conversion-to-common-weal-cause.21480728 |title=SNP millionaire's conversion to Common Weal cause |work=Sunday Herald|date=30 June 2013|accessdate=30 June 2013}}</ref>
The ''Common Weal'' was also discussed at [[Labour for Independence]]'s first conference in July 2013.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/home-news/labours-scottish-independence-group-call-for-trident-ban.1374938002|title=Labour's Scottish independence group calls for Trident ban |work=The Herald |date=27 July 2013|accessdate=27 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.stv.tv/politics/234255-labour-for-independence-group-holds-first-conference-at-glasgow-stuc/|title=Labour pro-independence group holds first conference in Glasgow |work=[[STV News]] |date=27 July 2013 |accessdate=27 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-politics-23472774 |title=Scottish independence: Labour Yes group in Trident ban call |work=[[BBC News]] |publisher=[[BBC]] |date=27 July 2013 |accessdate=27 July 2013}}</ref>
In August 2013, the Jimmy Reid Foundation led calls for a memorial to be erected in honour of those who opposed the outbreak of [[World War I]]. Its "alternative World War One Commemoration Committee" identified [[John Wheatley]], [[John Maclean (Scottish socialist)|John Maclean]], [[Mary Barbour]], [[Helen Crawfurd]], [[Jimmy Maxton]], [[Agnes Dollan]], [[Willie Gallacher (politician)|Willie Gallacher]], [[James Barr (politician)|Rev James Barr]], and [[Keir Hardie]] in its list of prominent opponents of the war.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/home-news/city-memorial-call-for-those-who-opposed-first-world-war.21801235 |title=City memorial call for those who opposed First World War |first=Robbie |last=Dinwoodie |work=The Herald |date=7 August 2013|accessdate=7 August 2013}}</ref>
Following the departure of the Foundation's first director, Robin McAlpine, to concentrate on the Common Weal, the Foundation has concentrated on a smaller number of projects, attempting to gain more subsequent follow through on each of those. The Foundation's work is initiated and monitored by its Project Board consisting of representatives from a number of unions (PCS, UNISON, Unite) as well as progressive and radical academics and policy analysts.
The [http://reidfoundation.org website of the Foundation] carries all its reports and publications <ref>http://reidfoundation.org/</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2017}} {{Infobox Russian term | russian = компрома́т | rusr = kompromat | native pronunciation = {{need-IPA|Russian}} <!-- {{ipa-ru||}} --> | literal meaning = compromising material }} In Russian culture, {{lang|ru|'''kompromat'''}}, short for "compromising material" ({{lang-ru|компрометирующий материал|translit=komprometiruyushchy material}}), is damaging information about a politician, a businessman, or other public figure, used to [[negative campaigning|create negative publicity]], as well as for [[blackmail]] and [[extortion]]. Kompromat may be acquired from various [[Security agency|security services]], or outright forged, and then publicized by use of a [[public relations]] official.<ref>{{Cite book |last=Hoffman |first=David |authorlink=David M. Hoffman |title=The Oligarchs: Wealth and Power in the New Russia |publisher=[[PublicAffairs]] |location=[[New York City|New York]] |year=2003 |page=272 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=OFh8kqMt2YoC&pg=PA272 |isbn=1-586-48202-5}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book |last=Koltsova |first=Olessia |title=News Media and Power in Russia |series=BASEES/Routledge series on Russian and East European Studies |publisher=[[Routledge]] |year=2006 |page=108 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RykxGY1KmFYC&pg=PA108 |isbn=0-415-34515-4}}</ref> Widespread use of {{lang|ru|kompromat}} has been one of the characteristic features of the [[politics of Russia]]<ref>{{Cite book |last1=White |first1=Stephen |authorlink1=Stephen White (political scientist) |last2=McAllister |first2=Ian |authorlink2=Ian McAllister (political scientist) |year=2006 |contribution=Politics and the Media in Post-Communist Russia |editor-last=Voltmer |editor-first=Katrin |title=Mass Media and Political Communication in New Democracies |series=Routledge/ECPR studies in European political science |publisher=[[Routledge]] |location=[[Abingdon-on-Thames]] |pages=225–226 |contribution-url=http://polsc.anu.edu.au/staff/mcallister/pubs/Russiamedia.pdf | access-date=2018-09-16 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060819190823/http://polsc.anu.edu.au/staff/mcallister/pubs/Russiamedia.pdf |archive-date=2006-08-19 |isbn=0-415-33779-8 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> and other [[post-Soviet states]].<ref>{{Cite book |last=Wheatley |first=Jonathan |title=Georgia from National Awakening to Rose Revolution: Delayed Transition in the Former Soviet Union |publisher=[[Ashgate Publishing]] |year=2005 |pages=104–105 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=80T4YjHFxycC&pg=PA105&lpg=PA105 |isbn=0-754-64503-7}}</ref><ref>[http://ukrainianweek.com/Politics/88989 Operation Smear Campaign], [[The Ukrainian Week]] (10 September 2013)</ref>
== Etymology == The term {{lang|ru|kompromat}} is a borrowing of the Russian KGB slang term {{lang|ru|компромат}} from the [[Stalin]] era, which is short for "compromising material" ({{lang-ru|компрометирующий материал|translit=komprometiruyushchy material}}). It refers to disparaging information that can be collected, stored, traded, or used strategically across all domains: political, electoral, legal, professional, judicial, media, and business. The origins of the term trace back to 1930s secret police jargon.<ref name="Ledeneva">{{cite book|last1=Ledeneva|first1=Alena V.|title=How Russia Really Works: The Informal Practices That Shaped Post-Soviet Politics and Business|date=30 September 2013|publisher=[[Cornell University Press]] |isbn=9780801470059 |pages=288 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bf7PAQAAQBAJ|access-date=12 January 2017}}</ref>
== Techniques == In the early days, {{lang|ru|kompromat}} featured doctored photographs, planted drugs, grainy videos of liaisons with prostitutes hired by the KGB, and a wide range of other primitive entrapment techniques. However, more contemporary forms of {{lang|ru|kompromat}} appear as a form of [[cybercrime]].<ref name="NYT"/> One aspect of {{lang|ru|kompromat}} that stands the test of time is that the compromising information is often sexual in nature.<ref name="TIME">{{cite magazine |last1=Waxman|first1=Olivia B.|title=Document Claims Russia Has Donald Trump 'Kompromat.' What Is That?|url=http://time.com/4632111/kompromat-history-donald-trump/ |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |location=[[New York City|New York]] |access-date=2017-01-12 |date=2017-01-12 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
== Use == {{lang|ru|Kompromat}} is part of the political culture in Russia, with many members of the business and political elite having collected and stored potentially compromising material on their political opponents.<ref name="NS">{{cite magazine |last1=Maher |first1=Richard |title=What is 'kompromat' and how does it work? |url=http://www.newstatesman.com/world/north-america/2017/01/what-kompromat-and-how-does-it-work |magazine=[[New Statesman]] |issn= 1364-7431 |location=[[London]] |publisher=[[GlobalData]] |access-date=12 January 2017|date=12 January 2017 |quote=Kompromat has become a part of the political culture in Russia. Nearly everyone within Russia’s business and political elite has at one time or another collected and stored potentially compromising material on their political opponents for future use. Kompromat can be real or fabricated, and generally involves drugs, prostitutes, sexual escapades, sleazy business deals, illicit financial schemes, or embezzlement.}}</ref> {{lang|ru|Kompromat}} does not necessarily target individuals or groups, but rather collects information that could be useful at a later time.<ref name="PRI">{{cite web |last=Woolf |first=Christopher |title=Moscow's long history of gathering 'kompromat' |url=http://www.pri.org/stories/2017-01-11/moscow-s-long-history-gathering-kompromat |publisher=[[Public Radio International]] |location=[[Minneapolis]] |access-date=12 January 2017 |date=11 January 2017 |quote=“Kompromat,” says David Filipov, “means 'compromising material' that can be used down the road as leverage over somebody. [...] “This was something former KGB officers were telling us here,” adds Filipov, “they’re not necessarily targeting you. You show up and they say, let’s just see what this guy does. So they’ll record you, they’ll do surveillance, see what you’re up to. Some stuff gets in a file and maybe they can use it, maybe they can’t use it.}}</ref> Compromising videos are produced long in advance when in need for leverage of people.<ref name="Atlantic"/>
[[Opposition research]] is conducted in the U.S. to find compromising material on political opponents so that such material may be released to weaken the opponents. {{lang|ru|Kompromat}} differs, however, in that such information is used to exert influence over people.<ref>{{cite news |last=Tucker |first=Joshua |title=Everything you need to know about the Russian art of 'kompromat' |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/monkey-cage/wp/2017/01/12/everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-russian-art-of-kompromat/ |url-access=limited |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |access-date=12 January 2017 |date=12 January 2017 |issn=0190-8286}}</ref>
== History == In the 1950s, [[British civil servant]] [[John Vassall]] was a victim of a gay [[Honey trapping|honey trap]] operation, producing {{lang|ru|kompromat}} which could be used against him since [[LGBT_rights_in_the_United_Kingdom#Homosexuality_as_an_offence|homosexuality was illegal]] in Britain at the time.<ref name="CNN">{{cite news |last1=Jones |first1=Bryony |last2=Mackintosh |first2=Eliza |title=What is Kompromat?|url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/11/politics/what-is-kompromat/|website=[[CNN]]|access-date=12 January 2017|date=12 January 2017}}</ref> During a 1957 visit to Moscow, American journalist [[Joseph Alsop]] also fell victim to a gay honey trap operation conducted by the [[KGB]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Higgins |first1=Andrew |last2=Kramer |first2=Andrew |title=Sexual blackmail, Russia style: a history of 'kompromat' |url=http://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/europe/sexual-blackmail-russia-style-a-history-of-kompromat-1.2934451 |newspaper=[[The Irish Times]] |location=[[Dublin]] |access-date=12 January 2017|date=12 January 2017}}</ref>
In 1997, {{ill|Valentin Kovalyov|ru|Ковалёв, Валентин Алексеевич}} was removed as the [[Ministry of Justice (Russia)|Russian Minister of Justice]] after photographs of him with prostitutes in a sauna controlled by the [[Solntsevskaya Bratva]] [[Organized crime|crime organization]] were published in a newspaper.<ref name="Ledeneva"/> In 1999, a video aired with a man resembling [[Yury Skuratov]] in bed with two women that later would lead to his dismissal as [[Prosecutor General of Russia]]. It was released after he began looking into charges of corruption by President [[Boris Yeltsin]] and his associates.<ref name="WSJ">{{cite news |last1=Hodge |first1=Nathan |last2=Grove |first2=Thomas |title=Trump Dossier Spotlights Russian History of ‘Kompromat’ |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-dossier-spotlights-russian-history-of-kompromat-1484171169 |newspaper=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |location=[[New York City|New York]] |publisher=[[News Corp]] |access-date=2017-01-11 |date=2017-01-11 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In August 2009, videos allegedly released by the [[Federal Security Service|FSB]] purportedly featured American diplomat [[Brendan Kyle Hatcher]] making telephone calls, presumably to a prostitute, then engaging in sexual activity with a woman. The [[United States Department of State]] protested that it was a doctored, unproven tape.<ref name="Atlantic">{{cite magazine |last1=Ioffe |first1=Julia |title=How Blackmail Works in Russia |url=https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2017/01/kompromat-trump-dossier/512891/ |magazine=[[The Atlantic]] |location=[[Washington D.C.]] |access-date=11 January 2017|date=11 January 2017}}</ref> In April 2010, politician [[Ilya Yashin]] and comedian [[Victor Shenderovich]] were involved in a sex scandal with a woman claimed to have acted as a Kremlin honey trap to discredit opposition figures.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Osborn |first1=Andrew |title=Amateur model known as 'Katya' revealed as Russian honey trap bait |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/russia/7639592/Amateur-model-known-as-Katya-revealed-as-Russian-honeytrap-bait.html |newspaper=[[Daily Telegraph]] |location=[[London]] |publisher=[[Telegraph Media Group]] |date= 2010-04-28 ||access-date=2017-01-11 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The video was released only two days before the wedding of Shenderovich's daughter.<ref name="Atlantic"/>
In cases of {{lang|ru|kompromat}} during the early 21st century, Russian operatives have been suspected, or accused of, placing [[child pornography]] on the personal computers of individuals they were attempting to discredit.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Higgins |first1=Andrew |title=Foes of Russia Say Child Pornography Is Planted to Ruin Them |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/09/world/europe/vladimir-putin-russia-fake-news-hacking-cybersecurity.html?_r=0 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |publisher=[[A.G. Sulzberger]] |access-date=2017-01-26 |date=2016-12-09 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="NPR">{{cite episode |last=Myre |first=Greg |authorlink=Greg Myre |series=[[All Things Considered]] |title=A Russian Word Americans Need To Know: 'Kompromat' |url=https://www.npr.org/programs/all-things-considered/2017/01/12/509445863 |transcript-url=https://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/01/11/509305088/a-russian-word-americans-need-to-know-kompromat |transcript=A Russian Word Americans Need To Know: 'Kompromat' |network=[[National Public Radio]] |location=[[Washington D.C.]] |access-date=2017-01-11 |date=2017-01-11 |df=dmy-all |quote=In other recent cases, Russian operatives have been suspected or accused of placing child pornography on the personal computers of individuals they were attempting to discredit. Russian Vladimir Bukovsky, 73, a longtime critic of Soviet and Russian leaders, now lives in Britain, where he faces charges related to child pornography. But the case was delayed while investigators checked to see whether the images on Bukovsky's computer were placed there by an outside party, ''The New York Times'' reported last month, citing other similar cases.}}</ref> In 2015, the UK's [[Crown Prosecution Service]] announced that it would prosecute [[Vladimir Bukovsky]] for "prohibited images" found on his computer;<ref>{{cite web |title=Vladimir Bukovsky to be prosecuted over indecent images of children |url=http://www.cps.gov.uk/news/latest_news/vladimir_bukovsky_to_be_prosecuted_over_indecent_images_of_children/ |publisher=[[Crown Prosecution Service]] |access-date=2017-01-11 |date=2015-04-27 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> however, the case against Bukovshy had been put on hold as investigators are trying to determine whether the pornographic images were planted.<ref name="NYT">{{cite news |last1=Higgins |first1=Andrew |title=Foes of Russia Say Child Pornography Is Planted to Ruin Them |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/09/world/europe/vladimir-putin-russia-fake-news-hacking-cybersecurity.html |newspaper=[[The New York Times]]| publisher=[[A.G. Sulzberger]] |access-date=2017-01-11 |date=2016-12-09 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Ahead of the [[Russian legislative election, 2016|2016 Russian legislative election]], a [[sex tape]] of [[Mikhail Kasyanov]] emerged on [[NTV (Russia)|NTV]].<ref name="WSJ"/><ref name="NPR"/>
Following the [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016 U.S. presidential election]], it emerged on 10 January 2017, that U.S. intelligence agencies were investigating possibly [[Donald Trump–Russia dossier|compromising personal and financial information]] on President-elect [[Donald Trump]], leading to allegations that he and members of his administration may be vulnerable to manipulation by the Russian government.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Nelson |first1=Eliot |last2=Young |first2=Jeffrey |title=Kompromat? More Like KomproMAGA! |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/huffpost-hill-kompromat-more-like-kompromaga_us_5875640fe4b05b7a465c3854 |access-date=2017-01-11|website=[[The Huffington Post]] |publisher=[[Oath Inc.|Oath]] ||date=2017-01-10 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Trump says Russian 'kompromat' claims are fake |url=https://www.ft.com/content/2584ebdc-d796-11e6-944b-e7eb37a6aa8e |newspaper=[[Financial Times]] |location=[[London]] |publisher=[[Nikkei Inc.|Nikkei]] |date=2017-01-11 |access-date=2017-01-11 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
At a joint press conference on 16 July 2018 both Trump and Putin were asked point blank whether Russia had {{lang|ru|kompromat}} on Trump. Neither answered "no". Putin responded: {{quote|Yeah, I did hear these rumours that we allegedly collected compromising material on Mr Trump when he was visiting Moscow. Well, distinguished colleague, let me tell you this: When President Trump was in Moscow back then, I didn't even know that he was in Moscow. I treat President Trump with the utmost respect, but back then when he was a private individual, a businessman, nobody informed me that he was in Moscow... Well, let's take St. Petersburg Economic Forum, for instance, There were over 500 American businessmen, high-ranking, high-level ones. I don't even remember the last names of each and every one of them. Well, do you remember -- do you think that we try to collect compromising material on each and every single one of them? Well, it's difficult to imagine an utter nonsense of a bigger scale than this. Well, please, just disregard these issues and don't think about this anymore again.<ref name="PutinTrump">{{cite news |last1=Wolf |first1=Z. Byron |title=Does Russia have Kompromat on Trump? Here's Putin's strange answer |url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/07/16/politics/kompromat-russia-trump/index.html |access-date=2018-07-16 |publisher=[[CNN]] |date=2018-07-16 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>}}
Trump simply answered "It would have been out long ago" before changing the subject and ending the press conference.<ref name="PutinTrump"/>
British [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] MP [[Chris Bryant]], an ex-chair of the all-party parliamentary group for Russia, who claims that the Russian government orchestrated a [[homophobic]] campaign to remove him from this position, has claimed that the Russian government has acquired {{lang|ru|kompromat}} on high-profile [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]] MPs including [[Boris Johnson]], [[Liam Fox]], [[Alan Duncan]], and [[David Davis (British politician)|David Davis]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Townsend |first1=Mark |last2=Smith |first2=David |title=Senior British politicians 'targeted by Kremlin' for smear campaigns |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/jan/14/russia-blackmail-chris-bryant-donald-trump-boris-johnson-liam-fox |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]] |location=[[London]] |date=2017-01-14 |access-date=2018-09-16 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Following a 2016 phone call between incoming-U.S. National Security Adviser [[Michael Flynn]] and Russian ambassador [[Sergey Kislyak]], Flynn allegedly lied to the [[White House]] on the extent of those contacts placing him in a position vulnerable to blackmail. According to congressional testimony delivered by former Acting [[United States Attorney General|U.S. Attorney General]] [[Sally Yates]], the [[Department of Justice]] believed that "General Flynn was compromised," and placed Flynn in “a situation where the national-security adviser essentially could be blackmailed by the Russians.”<ref name="Wright 2017">{{cite web | last=Wright | first=Austin | title=Sally Yates: ‘We believed that Gen. Flynn was compromised’ |website=[[Politico]] | date=2017-05-08 | url=https://www.politico.com/story/2017/05/08/sally-yates-testimony-michael-flynn-238043 |publisher=[[Capitol News Company]] |location=[[Arlington County, Virginia|Arlington]] |access-date=2018-02-24}}</ref><ref name="The New Yorker 2017">{{cite magazine | title=Michael Flynn’s Questionable Conduct, and Trump’s | magazine=[[The New Yorker]] |publisher=[[Condé Nast]] |date=2017-05-09 |url=https://www.newyorker.com/news/ryan-lizza/michael-flynns-questionable-conduct-and-trumps | access-date=2018-02-24 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
== See also == * [[Active measures]] * [[Character assassination]] * [[Cyberwarfare]] * [[Defamation]] * [[Discrediting tactic]] * [[Donald Trump–Russia dossier]] * [[False evidence]] * [[Negative campaigning]] * [[Opposition research]] * [[Smear campaign]]

'''The League of Struggle for Negro Rights''' was organized by the [[Communist Party USA|Communist Party]] in 1930 as the successor to the [[American Negro Labor Congress]]. The League was particularly active in organizing support for the "[[Scottsboro Boys]]", nine black men sentenced to death in 1931 for crimes they had not committed. It also campaigned for a separate black nation in the South, one of the CPUSA's principal tenets in the early 1930s, and against [[police brutality]], the Italian occupation of [[Ethiopia]] and [[Jim Crow law]]s, while also advocating a more general policy of opposition to [[fascism]] and support for the [[Soviet Union]].
[[Langston Hughes]] became its President in 1934. [[Harry Haywood]] was its General Secretary. The organization largely disappeared after 1935, when the Communist Party, as part of its [[Popular Front]] strategy, joined with other non-communist organizations and individuals to form the [[National Negro Congress]].
==See also== * [[The Communist Party and African-Americans]] * [[American Negro Labor Congress]]
== Pamphlets == *[http://archive.lib.msu.edu/AFS/dmc/radicalism/public/all/southcomesnorth/AAK.pdf?CFID=5171542&CFTOKEN=34331723 ''The South Comes North in Detroit's Own Scottsboro Case''] by Harry Haywood New York : Published for League of Struggle for Negro Rights, by Workers' Library Publishers, 1932 *[http://archive.lib.msu.edu/DMC/AmRad/shallnotdie.pdf ''They Shall Not Die! The Story of Scottsboro in Pictures; Stop the Legal Lynching!''] by [[Elizabeth Lawson]], [[Anton Refregier]] and [[B. D. Amis]] New York: Published for League of Struggle for Negro Rights, by Workers' Library Publishers, 1932 *[https://archive.org/details/EqualityLandAndFreedomAProgramForNegroLiberation ''Equality, land and freedom: a program for Negro liberation''] New York City : League of Struggle for Negro Rights, 1933 * [https://archive.org/details/TheBordenCaseTheStruggleForNegroRightsInBostonUnderTheLeadership ''The Borden case : the struggle for Negro rights in Boston, under the leadership of the L.S.N.R.''] Boston : The League, 1934. * [https://archive.org/details/youCannotKillTheWorkingClass ''"You cannot kill the working class,"''] New York: [[International Labor Defense]] and the League of Struggle for Negro Rights 1937.
